lines.text: Banking is one of the few dignified businesses left in the world, Miss Pringle. Do you mind if we keep it that way?

[to Hepburn]
Who are you to moralise, sitting there like some damn saint?

[to Pearson]
... and you might sat, in my opinion, it would take a very clever fellow to rob this bank...
The opinion of a common thief is of no interest to me.
I flatter myself I am a rather uncommon thief. A common one would just make off with the money, but I can't help interesting myself in people. It's a failing you ought to cultivate, Fordyce.
You know, I think banks are rather fun.
I detest brutality. I want bank robberies to be smoother and more sociable.
